intro: Borreria equisetoides, commonly known as the featherleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with small, opposite leaves. Borreria equisetoides is used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its delicate foliage.
